name: lib/load-methods.js
convertToCameCase
description: Converts a kebab-case string to camelCase

params.name: value
params.description: the kebab-case string

name: loadFile
description: Loads the actual file using `require()`

unknown.tagValue: {*} the export of the loaded file

params.name: name
params.description: the file name of the plugin to load

return.description: the export of the loaded file

name: lib/magik-vector.js
MagikVector
description:
MagikVector class for handling 2 dimensional, 3 dimensional or n dimensional
vectors

name: constructor
description:
Initialise a new Vector instance with coordinates as arguments, either
supply the individual coordinates or supply an array with number values.

params.name: {...number|array}[args]
params.description: optional coordinate list or Array

name: random
description:
Returns a new MagikVector with random coordinates, defaults to
a normalised 3D vector

params.name: dimensions
params.description: optional number of dimensions to use

name: rand
description: Alias for `random()`

params.name: dimensions
params.description: optional number of dimensions to use

name: random2D
description: Returns a new vector with two random coordinates

unknown.tagValue: {MagikVector} - instance of MagikVector with two random values

return.description: instance of MagikVector with two random values

name: random3D
description:
Returns a new vector with three random coordinates, basically this is an
alias for calling MagikVector.random() without any arguments.

unknown.tagValue: {MagikVector} - instance of MagikVector with three random values

return.description: instance of MagikVector with three random values

name: randomInteger
description:
Returns a random integer optionally bound by the minimum(included) and
maximum (included) arguments. If only one argument is supplied, it is
the maximum number (same as `MagikVector.randomInteger(0, maximum)`)

params.name: args.minimum
params.description: optional minimum value

params.name: ars.maximum
params.description: optional maximum value

name: randomInt
description:
Returns a random integer optionally bound by the minimum(included) and
maximum (included) arguments. If only one argument is supplied, it is
the maximum number (same as `MagikVector.randomInteger(0, maximum)`)

params.name: args.minimum
params.description: optional minimum value

params.name: ars.maximum
params.description: optional maximum value

name: toRadians
description: Converts degrees to radians

params.name: degrees
params.description: the number of degrees to convert

name: toDegrees
description: Converts radians to degrees

params.name: radians
params.description: the number of radians to convert

name: length
description:
Returns the length of the coordinates array, in other words the number
of dimensions of this MagikVector

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the number of dimensions of this MagikVector

return.description: the number of dimensions of this MagikVector

name: x
description: Returns the `x` coordinate of this Vector.
examples:
const vector = new MagikVector(3, 4, 5);
const xCoordinate = vector.x; // returns 3

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the `x` coordinate of this MagikVector instance

return.description: the `x` coordinate of this MagikVector instance

name: y
description: Returns the `y` coordinate of this Vector.
examples:
const vector = new MagikVector(3, 4, 5);
const yCoordinate = vector.y; // returns 4

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the `y` coordinate of this MagikVector instance

return.description: the `y` coordinate of this MagikVector instance

name: z
description: Returns the `z` coordinate of this Vector.
examples:
const vector = new MagikVector(3, 4, 5);
const zCoordinate = vector.z; // returns 5

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the `z` coordinate of this MagikVector instance

return.description: the `z` coordinate of this MagikVector instance

name: x
description: Sets the `x` coordinate of this MagikVector instance.
examples:
const vector = new MagikVector();
const vector.x = 3;

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set as x coordinate

name: y
description: Sets  the `y` coordinate of this MagikVector instance.
examples:
const vector = new MagikVector();
const vector.y = 4;

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set as y coordinate

name: z
description: Sets the `z` coordinate of this MagikVector instance.
examples:
const vector = new MagikVector();
const vector.z = 5;

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set as z coordinate

name: getX
description: Returns the `x` coordinate of this MagikVector instance.

name: getY
description: Returns the `y` coordinate of this MagikVector instance.

name: getZ
description: Returns the `z` coordinate of this MagikVector instance.

name: getCoordinate
description:
Returns the coordinate at the specified index, consider using:
`const x = vector.x` or `const x = vector.getX()`,
`const y = vector.y` or `const y = vector.getY()`,
`const z = vector.z` or `const z = vector.getZ()`,
to retrieve the coordinates of a 2D or 3D vector.

unknown.tagValue: {number|undefined} - value at the specified index or undefined

return.description: value at the specified index or undefined

name: getCoord
description: Alias of MagikVector.getCoordinate()

unknown.tagValue: {number|undefined} - value at the specified index or undefined

return.description: value at the specified index or undefined

name: setX
description:
Sets the `x` coordinate of this MagikVector and returns the instance
so it can be chained.
examples:
<caption>set x coordinate and chain</caption>
const vector = new MagikVector();
vector.setX(33).setY(44).setZ(55);

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set

name: setY
description:
Returns the `y` coordinate of this MagikVector and returns the instance
so it can be chained.
examples:
<caption>set y coordinate and chain</caption>
const vector = new MagikVector();
vector.setX(33).setY(44).setZ(55);

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set

name: setZ
description:
Returns the `z` coordinate of this MagikVector and returns the instance
so it can be chained.
examples:
<caption>set z coordinate and chain</caption>
const vector = new MagikVector();
vector.setX(33).setY(44).setZ(55);

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set

name: setCoordinate
description:
Sets the coordinate at the specified index, consider using
`vector.x = 3` or `vector.setX()`,
`vector.y = 4` or `vector.setY()`,
`vector.z = 5` or `vector.setZ()`,
to set the coordinates of a 2D or 3D vector.
Returns the instance so it's possible to chain this method.

params.name: index
params.description: the  index to set the value for

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set

name: setCoord
description: Alias of MagikVector.setCoordinate()

params.name: index
params.description: the  index to set the value for

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set

name: add
description:
Adds given vector to the current vector, i.e. adds the individual
coordinates.

params.name: vector
params.description: vector to add to current instance

name: subtract
description:
subtracts given vector from the current vector, i.e. subtracts the
individual coordinates.

params.name: vector
params.description: vector to subtract from current instance

name: sub
description: Alias of MagikVector.substract()

params.name: vector
params.description: vector to subtract from current instance

name: multiply
description:
Multiplies the current Vector by value, you can supply either a scalar value
or a Vector

params.name: value
params.description: scalar or Vector to use to multiply

name: mult
description: Alias for the `multiply()` method

params.name: value
params.description: scalar or Vector to use to multiply

name: divide
description: Divides the current vector by the supplied scalar or Vector value

params.name: value
params.description: scalar or MagikVector to use to divide

name: div
description: Alias for the `divide()` method

params.name: value
params.description: scalar or MagikVector to use to divide

name: clone
description:
Returns a clone of the current vector, i.e. creates a new Vector Object
with the same coordinates as the current MagikVector instance.

unknown.tagValue: {MagikVector} - returns a clone of the current instance

return.description: returns a clone of the current instance

name: getMagnitudeSquared
description: Returns the magnitude squared

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the magnitude squared value of the current instance

return.description: the magnitude squared value of the current instance

name: getMagnitude
description: Returns the magnitude of the vector

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the magnitude of the current instance

return.description: the magnitude of the current instance

name: getMag
description: Returns the magnitude of the vector

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the magnitude of the current instance

return.description: the magnitude of the current instance

name: setMagnitude
description: Sets the magnitude of the Vector and returns the changed vector

params.name: magnitude
params.description: magnitude to set this instance to

name: setMag
description: Alias for the `setMagnitude()` method

name: getDirection
description:
Calculates the direction, i.e. the angle of rotation for this vector
(only for 2D vectors)

unknown.tagValue: {number} the angle of rotation in radians

return.description: the angle of rotation in radians

name: getDir
description: Alias for the getDirection() method

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the angle of rotation in radians

return.description: the angle of rotation in radians

name: getDistanceTo
description: Returns the calculated distance from the current Vector to the supplied one

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the distance between the two vectors

params.name: vector
params.description: the vector to calculate the distance to

return.description: the distance between the two vectors

name: getDistance
description: Alias for the getDistanceTo() method

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the distance between the two vectors

params.name: vector
params.description: the vector to calculate the distance to

return.description: the distance between the two vectors

name: getDist
description: Alias for the getDistanceTo() method

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the distance between the two vectors

params.name: vector
params.description: the vector to calculate the distance to

return.description: the distance between the two vectors

name: dotProduct
description:
Returns the dot Product of the current Vector with the supplied Vector,
throws an Error if both Vectors do not have the same number of
coordinates

params.name: vector
params.description: vector to calculate the dot product with

name: dot
description: Alias for dotProduct()

params.name: vector
params.description: vector to calculate the dot product with

name: normalise
description: Normalises the Vector

name: normalize
description: Alias of normalise()

name: limit
description: Limits the magnitude of the Vector to the supplied scalar value

params.name: scalar
params.description: value to limit by

name: toString
description: Returns the string representation of the Vector

unknown.tagValue: {string} - a string representation of the Vector

return.description: a string representation of the Vector

content: [![CircleCI](https://circleci.com/gh/magikMaker/magik-vector.svg?style=svg)](https://circleci.com/gh/magikMaker/magik-vector) [![NPM version](https://badge.fury.io/js/magik-vector.svg)](http://badge.fury.io/js/magik-vector) [![npm module downloads](http://img.shields.io/npm/dt/magik-vector.svg)](https://www.npmjs.org/package/magik-vector) ## MagikVector Class for handling 2 dimensional, 3 dimensional or n dimensional vectors **Example** ```js // import the vector and create a new vector object const MagikVector = import 'MagikVector'; const vector = new MagikVector(); // initialise a new vector with `x` and `y` coordinates const vector2D = new MagikVector(12, 42); // it's also possible to add a `z` coordinate const vector3D = new MagikVector(15, 12, 71); // or even more coordinates const multiDimensional = new MagikVector(15, 12, 71, 7, 38, 0); // create a MagikVector from an Array const myCoordinates = [4, 6, 28, 5, 33, 12, 8, 22, 785, 38, 56]; const multiDimensional = new MagikVector(...myCoordinates); ``` * [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector) * [~MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) * [new MagikVector([...args])](#new_module_MagikVector..MagikVector_new) * _instance_ * [.length](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+length) number * [.x](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+x) number * [.y](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+y) number * [.z](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+z) number * [.x](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+x) void * [.y](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+y) void * [.z](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+z) void * [.getCoordinate(index)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getCoordinate) number \| undefined * [.setCoordinate(index, value)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+setCoordinate) MagikVector * [.add(vector)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+add) MagikVector * [.subtract(vector)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+subtract) MagikVector * [.multiply(value)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+multiply) MagikVector \| number * [.divide(value)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+divide) MagikVector * [.clone()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+clone) MagikVector * [.getMagnitudeSquared()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getMagnitudeSquared) number * [.getMagnitude()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getMagnitude) number * [.setMagnitude(magnitude)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+setMagnitude) MagikVector * [.getDirection()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getDirection) number * [.getDistanceTo(vector)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getDistanceTo) number * [.dotProduct(vector)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+dotProduct) number * [.normalise()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+normalise) MagikVector * [.limit(scalar)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+limit) MagikVector * [.toString()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+toString) string * _static_ * [.random([dimensions])](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.random) MagikVector * [.random2D()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.random2D) MagikVector * [.randomInteger([minimum], [maximum])](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.randomInteger) number * [.toRadians(degrees)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.toRadians) number * [.toDegrees(radians)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.toDegrees) number ### MagikVector~MagikVector **Kind**: inner class of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector) * [~MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) * [new MagikVector([...args])](#new_module_MagikVector..MagikVector_new) * _instance_ * [.length](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+length) number * [.x](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+x) number * [.y](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+y) number * [.z](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+z) number * [.x](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+x) void * [.y](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+y) void * [.z](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+z) void * [.getCoordinate(index)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getCoordinate) number \| undefined * [.setCoordinate(index, value)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+setCoordinate) MagikVector * [.add(vector)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+add) MagikVector * [.subtract(vector)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+subtract) MagikVector * [.multiply(value)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+multiply) MagikVector \| number * [.divide(value)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+divide) MagikVector * [.clone()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+clone) MagikVector * [.getMagnitudeSquared()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getMagnitudeSquared) number * [.getMagnitude()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getMagnitude) number * [.setMagnitude(magnitude)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+setMagnitude) MagikVector * [.getDirection()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getDirection) number * [.getDistanceTo(vector)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+getDistanceTo) number * [.dotProduct(vector)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+dotProduct) number * [.normalise()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+normalise) MagikVector * [.limit(scalar)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+limit) MagikVector * [.toString()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector+toString) string * _static_ * [.random([dimensions])](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.random) MagikVector * [.random2D()](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.random2D) MagikVector * [.randomInteger([minimum], [maximum])](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.randomInteger) number * [.toRadians(degrees)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.toRadians) number * [.toDegrees(radians)](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector.toDegrees) number #### new MagikVector([...args]) Initialise a new Vector instance with coordinates as arguments, either supply the individual coordinates or supply an array with number values. | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | [...args] | number \| array | optional coordinate list or Array | **Example** ```js // empty vector const vector = new MagikVector(); // two dimensional const vector2D = new MagikVector(12, 15); // three dimensional const vector3D = new MagikVector(12, 15, 71); // multi dimensional const multiDimensional = new MagikVector(3, 4, 5, 99, 12, 14, 42); // from Array const myCoordinates = [4, 6, 28, 5, 33, 12, 8, 22, 785, 38, 56]; const multiDimensional = new MagikVector(...myCoordinates); ``` #### magikVector.length number Returns the length of the coordinates array, in other words the number of dimensions of this Vector **Kind**: instance property of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: number - the number of dimensions of this Vector #### magikVector.x number Returns the `x` coordinate of this Vector. **Kind**: instance property of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: number - the `x` coordinate of this vector **Example** ```js const vector = new MagikVector(3, 4, 5); const xCoordinate = vector.x; // returns 3 ``` #### magikVector.y number Returns the `y` coordinate of this Vector. **Kind**: instance property of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: number - the `y` coordinate of this vector **Example** ```js const vector = new MagikVector(3, 4, 5); const yCoordinate = vector.y; // returns 4 ``` #### magikVector.z number Returns the `z` coordinate of this Vector. **Kind**: instance property of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: number - the `z` coordinate of this vector **Example** ```js const vector = new MagikVector(3, 4, 5); const zCoordinate = vector.z; // returns 5 ``` #### magikVector.x void Sets the `x` coordinate of this Vector. **Kind**: instance property of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | value | number | the value to set as x coordinate | **Example** ```js const vector = new MagikVector(); const vector.x = 3; ``` #### magikVector.y void Sets the `y` coordinate of this Vector. **Kind**: instance property of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | value | number | the value to set as y coordinate | **Example** ```js const vector = new MagikVector(); const vector.y = 4; ``` #### magikVector.z void Sets the `y` coordinate of this Vector. **Kind**: instance property of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | value | number | the value to set as z coordinate | **Example** ```js const vector = new MagikVector(); const vector.z = 5; ``` #### magikVector.getCoordinate(index) number \| undefined Returns the coordinate at the specified index, consider using getX(), getY() and getZ() to retrieve the coordinates of a 2D or 3D vector **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: number \| undefined - the coordinate at the specified index or undefined **See** - MagikVector.x - MagikVector.y - MagikVector.z | Param | Type | | --- | --- | | index | number | #### magikVector.setCoordinate(index, value) MagikVector Sets the coordinate at the specified index, consider using setX(), setY() and setZ() to set the coordinates of a 2D or 3D vector **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: MagikVector - the object itself **See** - MagikVector.x - MagikVector.y - MagikVector.z | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | index | number | the index to set the value for | | value | number | the value to set | #### magikVector.add(vector) MagikVector Adds given vector to the current vector, i.e. adds the individual coordinates. **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: MagikVector - returns the current Vector | Param | Type | | --- | --- | | vector | MagikVector | #### magikVector.subtract(vector) MagikVector subtracts given vector from the current vector, i.e. subtracts the individual coordinates. **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: MagikVector - returns the current Vector | Param | Type | | --- | --- | | vector | MagikVector | #### magikVector.multiply(value) MagikVector \| number Multiplies the current Vector by value, you can supply either a scalar value or a Vector **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: MagikVector \| number - returns the current Vector | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | value | MagikVector \| number | scalar or Vector to use to multiply | #### magikVector.divide(value) MagikVector Divides the current vector by the supplied scallar or Vector value **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: MagikVector - the divided MagikVector | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | value | MagikVector \| number | scalar or MagikVector to use to divide | #### magikVector.clone() MagikVector Returns a clone of the current vector, i.e. creates a new Vector Object with the same coordinates as the current vector **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) #### magikVector.getMagnitudeSquared() number Returns the magnitude squared **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) #### magikVector.getMagnitude() number Returns the magnitude of the vector **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) #### magikVector.setMagnitude(magnitude) MagikVector Sets the magnitude of the Vector and returns the changed vector **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: MagikVector - the adjusted MagikVector object | Param | Type | | --- | --- | | magnitude | number | #### magikVector.getDirection() number Calculates the direction, i.e. the angle of rotation for this vector (only for 2D vectors) **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: number - the angle of rotation in radians #### magikVector.getDistanceTo(vector) number Returns the calculated distance from the current Vector to the supplied one **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: number - the distance between the two vectors | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | vector | MagikVector | the vector to calculate the distance to | #### magikVector.dotProduct(vector) number Returns the dot Product of the current Vector with the supplied Vector, throws an Error if both Vectors do not have the same number of coordinates **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | | --- | --- | | vector | MagikVector | #### magikVector.normalise() MagikVector Normalises the Vector **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: MagikVector - the normalised Vector #### magikVector.limit(scalar) MagikVector Limits the magnitude of the Vector to the supplied scalar value **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | | --- | --- | | scalar | number | #### magikVector.toString() string Returns the string representation of the Vector **Kind**: instance method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: string - the string representation of the Vector #### MagikVector.random([dimensions]) MagikVector Returns a new vector with random coordinates, defaults to a 3D vector **Kind**: static method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | Default | Description | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [dimensions] | number | 3 | optional number of dimensions to use | #### MagikVector.random2D() MagikVector Returns a new vector with two random coordinates **Kind**: static method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) **Returns**: MagikVector - the vector with two random values #### MagikVector.randomInteger([minimum], [maximum]) number Returns a random integer optionally bound by the minimum(included) and maximum (included) arguments. If only one argument is supplied, it is the maximum number (same as `MagikVector.randomInteger(0, maximum)`) **Kind**: static method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | [minimum] | number | minimal value | | [maximum] | number | maximal value | #### MagikVector.toRadians(degrees) number Converts degrees to radians **Kind**: static method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | | --- | --- | | degrees | number | **Example** *(Convert degrees to Radians)* ```js radians = MagikVector.toRadians(degrees); ``` #### MagikVector.toDegrees(radians) number Converts radians to degrees **Kind**: static method of [MagikVector](#module_MagikVector..MagikVector) | Param | Type | | --- | --- | | radians | number | **Example** *(Convert Radian to degrees)* ```js degrees = MagikVector.toDegrees(radians); ``` # License Copyright (C) 2016 - 2021 Bjrn Wikkeling (magikMaker) Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions: The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software. THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDER BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE. Except as contained in this notice, the name(s) of the above copyright holders shall not be used in advertising or otherwise to promote the sale, use or other dealings in this Software without prior written authorization.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@magikmaker/magik-vector",
  "version": "0.7.0",
  "description": "Vector class for 2D, 3D and multi dimensional vector calculations",
  "main": "./lib/magik-vector.js",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git://github.com/magikMaker/magik-vector.git"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "yarn test:watcher",
    "doc": "esdoc --debug -c ./config/esdoc.json",
    "doc:readme": "jsdoc2md -t config/readme-template.hbs ./lib/magik-vector.js  > README.md; echo",
    "//lint": "eslint lib",
    "//lint:fix": "eslint --fix lib",
    "lint": "eslint . -c ./config/.eslintrc --ignore-path ./config/.eslintignore",
    "lint:fix": "eslint . --fix -c ./config/.eslintrc --ignore-path ./config/.eslintignore",
    "prebuild": "yarn lint && yarn test",
    "prepublishOnly": "yarn doc:readme",
    "start": "yarn test:watcher",
    "server": "nodemon --exec \"yarn test && yarn lint && yarn server\"",
    "test": "yarn test:unit && yarn test:coverage",
    "test:ci": "yarn test:unit",
    "test:coverage": "nyc --reporter=text-summary --reporter=html mocha --opts ./config/mocha.opts",
    "test:coverage:ci": "nyc report --reporter=clover --reporter=lcov",
    "test:unit": "mocha --opts ./config/mocha.opts",
    "test:watcher": "nodemon --exec \"yarn lint && yarn test\"",
    "1test": "yarn run test:unit",
    "1test:report": "nyc --all --reporter=text --reporter=html mocha --opts ./config/mocha.opts",
    "1test:report:watch": "nodemon --exec \"yarn run lint && yarn run 1test:report\"",
    "1test:unit": "nyc --all --reporter=text mocha --opts ./config/mocha.opts",
    "1test:unit:ci": "nyc --all --reporter=text-summary mocha --opts ./config/mocha.opts",
    "1test:watch": "nodemon --exec \"yarn run lint && yarn run test\""
  },
